greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Sum of Wilson and Lerch remainders of n-th prime.
comment: a(n) = 0 if and only if prime(n) is in both A007540 and A197632, i.e., prime(n) is simultaneously a Wilson prime and a Lerch prime.
For n > 2, a(n) = 0 if and only if A027641(3*p-3) / A027642(3*p-3)-1 + 1/p == 0 (mod p^2), where p = prime(n) (cf. Dobson, 2016, theorem 2).

René Gy (see links) has shown that a number is simultaneously a Lerch prime and a Wilson prime if and only if it satisfies the supercongruence (p - 1)! + 1 == 0 (mod p^3). - _John Blythe Dobson_, Feb 23 2018
link: John Blythe Dobson, A Characterization of Wilson-Lerch Primes, Integers, 16 (2016), A51.
René Gy, Generalized Lerch Primes, Integers 18 (2018), A10.
J. Sondow, Lerch Quotients, Lerch Primes, Fermat-Wilson Quotients, and the Wieferich-non-Wilson Primes 2, 3, 14771, in Proceedings of CANT 2011, arXiv:1110.3113 [math.NT], 2011-2012.
program: a197631(n) = my(p=prime(n), m=p-1); sum(k=1, m, k^m, -p-m!)/p^2 % p
results.author: _Felix Fröhlich_, Aug 07 2016
